intro: Descurainia californica, commonly known as California tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed areas such as roadsides and gravelly soils. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
